籤詩版本二:
Going home in the wind and rain
It is precisely because of his body that he looks like a swallow
I want to use Ni Lai as a base
In the end, the beard mud will be destroyed
詩意: This hexagram represents the image of a swallow holding a Ni in its mouth. Everything is laborious and laborious.
解曰: All kinds of tricks. Morning and dusk are non-stop. Who knows this. After all, it’s hard work.
籤詩故事一:
◇Dong Yong buried his father
Dong Yong of the Han Dynasty was a man of Qiancheng. His family was poor and he lost his mother when he was young, so he had to support his father alone.
When his father died, Dong Yong had no money to bury him, so he borrowed 10,000 yuan from others to bury his father. In the future, if I have no money to pay back, I will become a slave. Every day they have to fetch one load of firewood, four loads of water, and hoe six or seven acres of fields, which is a lot of hard work.
(This story is a metaphor for working hard, but you have nothing left.)
聖意:
Home and house: bad things happen first and then good things happen.
Beware of yourself.
Seeking wealth Yes.
Transaction completed.
Marriage is not compatible.
Rokko Male.
Travelers are lucky.
Tiancan: Profit.


Six animals benefit.
Looking for someone to meet.
The lawsuit is justified.
Migration An.
Lost things are seen.
Disease makes a wish.
Mountain tomb is auspicious.
